qas.question: Which cities other than Knoxville have been the capital of Tennessee?
How many counties are part of Nashville's metropolitan area?
What distance in miles is Clarksville, TN from Nashville?
Which city is Tennessee's sixth largest by population?
Which two of the six most populous Tennessee cities are nearest the Great Smoky Mountains?

context: The capital is Nashville, though <a0_0>Knoxville, Kingston, and Murfreesboro<a0_0/> have all served as state capitals in the past. Memphis has the largest population of any city in the state. Nashville's <a1_0>13<a1_0/>-county metropolitan area has been the state's largest since c. 1990. <a4_0>Chattanooga and Knoxville<a4_0/>, both in the eastern part of the state near the Great Smoky Mountains, each has approximately one-third of the population of Memphis or Nashville. The city of Clarksville is a fifth significant population center, some <a2_0>45<a2_0/> miles (72 km) northwest of Nashville. <a3_0>Murfreesboro<a3_0/> is the sixth-largest city in Tennessee, consisting of some 108,755 residents.
